name: DorkAgent
description: ü§ñ LLM-powered agent for automated Google Dorking in bug hunting & pentesting.
readme_summary: DorkAgent is an LLM-powered Python tool designed to automate Google Dorking for bug hunting and penetration testing. It leverages AI models and search engine APIs to discover vulnerabilities and gather intelligence.
key_features: Customizable search result count and time duration
Structured task output validation with Pydantic models
primary_use_case: Automating the process of finding security vulnerabilities and gathering information through Google Dorking for cybersecurity professionals.
cover_image_prompt: A digital detective, wearing a futuristic trench coat, stands before a massive, glowing Google search bar. Instead of typing, the detective uses a holographic interface, projecting complex dork queries as intricate, glowing webs. These webs ensnare hidden digital secrets and vulnerabilities, represented by small, locked chests and flashing red icons, which are then neatly organized into a secure vault. Subtle code snippets and data streams flow around the scene, hinting at the underlying automation. The overall mood is one of focused intelligence gathering in a dimly lit, tech-infused environment. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a dark, high-tech color palette and glowing accents.

name: WEF
readme_summary: The WEF (Wi-Fi Exploitation Framework) is a shell-based tool designed for security researchers and penetration testers. It automates and facilitates the analysis and exploitation of vulnerabilities in WPA/WPA2, WPS, and WEP Wi-Fi networks, supporting both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands.
key_features: WPA/WPA2/WPA3, WPS, WEP, Rogue-AP, and Handshake Attacks
Automatic attack mode based on AP features
Simple login template for Evil Twin attack
Monitor mode toggle and network interface information
primary_use_case: Analyzing and exploiting vulnerabilities in Wi-Fi networks for security testing.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled digital locksmith, depicted as a modern-day artisan, is meticulously crafting a complex, glowing key. Around the locksmith, various Wi-Fi symbols and network signals are represented as intricate, locked doors and intricate digital pathways. The locksmith uses specialized tools that resemble a blend of traditional lock-picking instruments and futuristic data streams to analyze and bypass these digital locks. Subtle UI elements showing network analysis and potential vulnerabilities are visible on a nearby holographic screen. The overall scene is set in a dimly lit, high-tech workshop, emphasizing the precision and analytical nature of Wi-Fi security exploitation. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on intricate details and a cool, analytical color palette.

name: copyparty
description: Portable file server with accelerated resumable uploads, dedup, WebDAV, SFTP, FTP, TFTP, zeroconf, media indexer, thumbnails++ all in one file
readme_summary: Copyparty is a versatile, portable file server that supports multiple protocols including HTTP, WebDAV, SFTP, FTP, and TFTP. It excels at accelerated, resumable uploads and downloads, deduplication, and offers features like media indexing and thumbnail generation, all runnable with just Python.
key_features: Multiple protocols: HTTP(S), WebDAV, SFTP, FTP(S), TFTP, SMB/CIFS
Web-based UI accessible from any browser
Optional dependencies, runs with just Python
primary_use_case: To easily set up a file server on almost any device, accessible via multiple protocols and a web browser, with robust upload and download capabilities.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, anthropomorphic suitcase overflowing with digital files and folders, acting as a central hub. From one side, streams of data (represented by glowing particles) are being rapidly uploaded into the suitcase, while from the other side, other streams of data are being downloaded. A small, stylized web browser window is subtly integrated into the suitcase's surface, displaying a progress bar for an ongoing transfer. The suitcase has small, subtle labels like 'copyparty' and icons representing different protocols (HTTP, SFTP, FTP). The background is a clean, abstract digital space with soft, gradient lighting. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a friendly and accessible aesthetic, emphasizing ease of use and efficient data transfer.

name: Uscrapper
description: Uscrapper Vanta: Dive deeper into the web with this powerful open-source tool. Extract valuable insights with ease and efficiency, from both surface and deep web sources. Empower your data mining and analysis with Vanta's advanced capabilities. Fast, reliable, and user-friendly, Uscrapper Vanta is the ultimate choice for researchers and analysts.
readme_summary: Uscrapper Vanta is an open-source Python tool designed for comprehensive web scraping, capable of extracting various data points from both the surface and deep web. It leverages multithreading and advanced anti-scraping defenses to gather information like email addresses, social media links, and geolocations, with new support for dark web (.onion) links and keyword-based scraping.
key_features: Extraction of Email Addresses, Social Media Links, Author Names, Geolocations, Phone Numbers, Usernames
Crawl and scrape within the same domain
primary_use_case: Data extraction and intelligence gathering from the surface and deep web, including dark web sources, with a focus on personal information and keyword-specific data.
cover_image_prompt: A deep-sea explorer in a high-tech submersible, equipped with a glowing net, descending into a dark, mysterious ocean trench representing the deep web. The submersible's spotlight illuminates scattered digital artifacts like email icons, social media logos, and location pins. The explorer is actively scooping these items into the net, which is overflowing with organized data streams. Subtle UI elements on the submersible's viewport show keyword search results and a progress bar. The overall mood is one of discovery and uncovering hidden information. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a dark, atmospheric color palette, emphasizing the contrast between the submersible's light and the dark depths.

name: VKGroupParser
readme_summary: This Python repository is designed to parse posts and comments from VKontakte, filter them by keywords using fuzzy matching and spell checking, and store the results in a MongoDB database. It also includes a Telegram bot for remote management and control.
key_features: Keyword filtering with fuzzy matching and spell checking
primary_use_case: Automated collection and filtering of VKontakte content for analysis or archival, with remote management capabilities.
cover_image_prompt: A digital librarian meticulously sifting through a vast, flowing river of VKontakte posts and comments. The librarian uses a magnifying glass that highlights keywords with glowing outlines and a subtle spell-checking aura. Selected posts transform into organized digital books, neatly stacking into a MongoDB database visualized as a futuristic, glowing library. A small, friendly robot (representing the Telegram bot) stands nearby, holding a tablet displaying control commands. The scene is set in a clean, modern digital archive with soft, ambient lighting. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with clear iconography and a focus on the flow of information.
